import React, {useEffect, useRef} from "react"; import UnityImg from "../assets/images/unity-img.png"; import UE5Img from "../assets/images/ue5-img.png"; import GodotImg from "../assets/images/godot-img.png"; import CSharpImg from "../assets/images/c#-img.png"; import CPlusPlusImg from "../assets/images/c++-img.png"; import PhotoshopImg from "../assets/images/photoshop-img.png"; import RiderImg from "../assets/images/rider-img.png"; import GitImg from "../assets/images/git-img.png"; import VSImg from "../assets/images/vs-img.png"; const Resume = () => { const colors = [ "#BCE70C", "#FF759C", "#00CC97", "#FFDB59", "#6F39FD", "#FF7D61", ]; const progressRef = useRef(null); const hasAnimated = useRef(false); // Track if the animation has already run return ( <> {/* */}

Education.

Bachelor in Architecture and Urbanism

UNIVERSIDADE CRUZEIRO DO SUL | 2013-2017

Management 3.0 Certification

Alura / 2020

PSM I Certification

Experience.

Game Designer

Wildlife Studios 09/2024 - 10/2025

Designing and balancing game mechanics and levels, calibrating player progression to create immersive player experiences.







Next, I was tasked with redesigning the project's entire UI. Collaborating closely with the design team, I led the overhaul, which involved creating the foundational code and automations for the new interface. Key improvements included automating UI generation for new exams, revamping the exam access interface, updating patient information displays, implementing a new tooltips system, and creating a new UI for questions and answers.



I then worked on developing a series of abdominal exams alongside another developer. We meticulously crafted the entire process for routine abdominal examinations, mirroring a doctor's approach with a patient. This included inspection, palpation, percussion, and more, totaling 11 exams, many of which featured animations, trigger points, and blendshapes.



My most recent and final task involved developing two groups of complex exams: Reflexes and Motor. These exams are critical for confirming diagnoses in specific cases, requiring precise doctor-patient interactions, animation synchronization, and interface interactions. Some exams demanded detailed point-by-point interaction with the patient, where the doctor’s hand needed to be accurately positioned on the patient’s body while the patient moved. I developed all 11 exams in this package, and toward the end of the project, I collaborated with colleagues to polish the final product and resolve any remaining issues.

Product Manager

Wildlife Studios 02/2024 - 09/2024

Associate Product Manager for Midas Merge, accountable for in-game live events. Designing and refining features, analyzing game data and working closely to art, data, PX and development teams



My second and final project was a Bingo game, which is essentially a match game where random numbers are drawn, and each player marks them on their board. It’s a multiplayer game with real-time matchmaking. In this project, I collaborated with a more senior developer, but I also contributed significantly to the development. We used Photon to manage the multiplayer networking, which greatly facilitated the process. This game was also successfully published in the stores.

{/* */} {/* */}
